byline.original: The New York Times and MSNBC

docs.lead_paragraph: John Harwood, of the The Times and CNBC, talks to Sheryl Gay Stolberg, Jeff Zeleny, Helene Cooper, and Gretchen Morgenson.
docs.snippet: John Harwood, of the The Times and CNBC, talks to Sheryl Gay Stolberg, Jeff Zeleny, Helene Cooper, and Gretchen Morgenson....

headline.main: Stimulus Bill Bears Imprint of Technology

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

docs.lead_paragraph: To rally support for his administration's economic recovery bill recently, President Obama invited about a dozen chief executives, seven of them from technology and energy companies, to the Oval Office. Some of their industries' top lobbyists, meanwhile, gathered in another office where Jason Furman, a top White House economic adviser, delivered a private briefing for groups expected to benefit most from the stimulus bill.
docs.snippet: The economic stimulus bill could also be a springboard for action on some of President Obama’s clean energy and technology goals....

headline.main: Obama Gives $500 Million to Climate Fund Over GOP Objections
headline.print_headline: Obama Gives $500 Million to Climate Fund Over GOP Objections

docs.lead_paragraph: With just three days left in office, the Obama administration has doubled an initial $500 million commitment to a fund that helps developing nations fight climate change and adapt to its consequences.
docs.snippet: With just three days left in office, the Obama administration has doubled an initial $500 million commitment to a fund that helps developing nations fight climate change and adapt to its consequences....

headline.main: Obama Hands Down Several High Profile Clemencies, Pardons
headline.print_headline: Obama Hands Down Several High Profile Clemencies, Pardons

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Tuesday shortened the prison sentences of 209 people and granted pardons to another 64.

headline.main: Obama to Trump: Keep Russia Sanctions Separate From Nuclear Talks
headline.print_headline: Obama to Trump: Keep Russia Sanctions Separate From Nuclear Talks

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama urged President-elect Donald Trump on Wednesday to keep separate the issue of economic sanctions on Russia from the pursuit of talks to reduce nuclear stockpiles.
docs.snippet: President Barack Obama urged President-elect Donald Trump on Wednesday to keep separate the issue of economic sanctions on Russia from the pursuit of talks to reduce nuclear stockpiles....

headline.main: Obama Says Reducing Leaker Chelsea Manning's Prison Term Serves Justice
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Reducing Leaker Chelsea Manning's Prison Term Serves Justice

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said on Wednesday that former military intelligence analyst Chelsea Manning had served a tough prison term and his decision to commute her 35-year sentence to about seven years served would not signal leniency toward leakers of U.S. government secrets.
docs.snippet: President Barack Obama said on Wednesday that former military intelligence analyst Chelsea Manning had served a tough prison term and his decision to commute her 35-year sentence to about seven years served would not signal leniency toward leakers...

headline.main: Obama Shortens Sentence of Manning, Who Gave Secrets to WikiLeaks
headline.print_headline: Obama Shortens Sentence of Manning, Who Gave Secrets to WikiLeaks

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama on Tuesday shortened the prison sentence of Chelsea Manning, the former U.S. military intelligence analyst who was responsible for a 2010 leak of classified materials to anti-secrecy group WikiLeaks, the biggest such breach in U.S. history.

headline.main: EPA Withdraws Obama-Era Request for Data on Oil, Natural Gas
headline.print_headline: EPA Withdraws Obama-Era Request for Data on Oil, Natural Gas

docs.lead_paragraph: The Environmental Protection Agency said Thursday it is withdrawing an Obama-era request that oil and natural gas companies provide information on methane emissions at oil and gas operations.
docs.snippet: The Environmental Protection Agency said Thursday it is withdrawing an Obama-era request that oil and natural gas companies provide information on methane emissions at oil and gas operations....

headline.seo: In Gingrich Mold, a New Voice for G.O.P. Resistance
headline.main: In Gingrich Mold, a New Voice for Solid Republican Resistance
headline.print_headline: In Gingrich Mold, a New Voice For Solid Resistance in G.O.P.

docs.lead_paragraph: Eric Cantor, the House minority whip, is as responsible as anyone for the tough party line taken in the standoff with President Obama over the stimulus bill.

headline.main: House Democrats Release Details of Their Tax Plan
headline.print_headline: House Democrats Release Details of Their Tax Plan

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn reported from Washington, and Jeff Zeleny from Bedford Heights, Ohio. Stephen Labaton contributed reporting from Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: The proposed economic recovery package included a middle-class tax cut, tax breaks for college tuition and first-time homebuyers, and incentives to encourage renewable energy production.
docs.snippet: The proposed economic recovery package included a middle-class tax cut, tax breaks for college tuition and first-time homebuyers, and incentives to encourage renewable energy production....
